title: Shada
dialogue_triumphs: Doctor: 'When I was on the river I heard the strange babble of inhuman voices, didn't you, Romana?' Chronotis: '… Oh, probably undergraduates talking to each other, I expect. I'm trying to have it banned.'

Regrettably unfilmed is an exchange between the Doctor and Skagra on ruling the Universe: 'It's a troublesome place,' says the Doctor, 'difficult to administer, and as a piece of real estate it's worthless because by definition there'd be no one to sell it to.' Skagra doesn't want to conquer the Universe: 'The Universe, Doctor, as you so crudely put it, will be me!'
dialogue_disasters: 'It's just a Gallifrey nursery book. I had it when I was a Time Tot.'
Professor Chronotis is trying to remember the name of the person he lent the book to: 'A? A? No, it doesn't begin with “A”. B? B, B-' 'C?' chorus the Doctor and Romana.
goofs: Clare Keightley drops her books before running into the porter.
In episode two, Romana calls Chris by his first name, despite not having heard it.

continuity_notes.name: Salyavin
continuity_notes.description: A notorious mind-controlling criminal and a semi-hero of the young Doctor's, later known as Professor Chronotis.
continuity_notes.current_status: Living as Professor Chronotis at Cambridge, seeking to recover the Ancient Law of Gallifrey.

continuity_notes.name: The Ancient Law of Gallifrey
continuity_notes.description: A book dating back to the days of Rassilon, acting as a key to Shada.
continuity_notes.current_status: Stolen from Gallifrey, being sought after by both Salyavin and Skagra.

continuity_notes.name: Shada
continuity_notes.current_status: Holding various prisoners, including a Dalek, Cyberleader, and Zygon.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS (Chronotis)
continuity_notes.description: Professor Chronotis's time machine, disguised as his rooms.
continuity_notes.current_status: Located at Cambridge, more primitive than the Doctor's TARDIS.

technobabble: The Doctor orders Skagra's ship to reverse the polarity of its main warp feeds.

Chronotis and Clare find themselves 'jammed between two irrational time interfaces': his TARDIS's conceptor geometry relay, with magranomic trigger, has a defunct field separator, but this won't be needed if they can fix the interfacial resonator.

locations.name: The Think Tank space station
locations.description: Space station used by Skagra's scientists.

locations.name: Cambridge
locations.description: Location of Professor Chronotis's rooms and TARDIS.

locations.name: Skagra's ship
locations.description: Ship used by Skagra to carry out his plans.

locations.name: Shada
locations.current_status: Holding various prisoners, including a Dalek, Cyberleader, and Zygon.

untold_adventures: The Doctor's honorary degree from St Cedd's College, Cambridge, in 1960.
The Doctor's visits to Professor Chronotis in 1955, 1960 and 1964, and in 1958 in a different incarnation.
additional_notes: The story was not completed due to strike action and has been described as having a cheap look and some dull comedy, but with an interesting basic plot and well-executed Cambridge scenes.
bottom_line: 'I dunno, nowadays they'll publish anything.' Infamous because it was never completed, it was for a long time stated that 'Shada' would have been the highlight of the seventeenth season. What was filmed doesn't quite encourage such optimism.
